intro: Oxymitra borneensis var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran oxymitra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a faintly fragrant aroma. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
